column4: displayName
ProMetaS Image Metadata
description
Date when original image(s) was taken.(ISO 8601 Standard of Date Time Format)
Date when the images were taken ,for example(for date):  YYYY-MM-DD.
Time when original image(s) was taken.(ISO 8601 Standard of Time Format: HH:mm:ss)
A measure for the open aperture of a photographic objective. (also known as Aperture value) (eg: f/4)
The class of program used by camera to set exposure when the picture is taken (eg: Manual)
Spectral sensitivity of each channel of camera. (example: infrared or ultraviolet or visible light) (eg: VisibleLight)
Sensitivity of camera when image was shot (Also called as ISOSpeedRatings by EXIF2.2 and PhotographicSensitivity by the EXIF 2.3 spec) (eg: 400)
Shutter Speed in seconds (eg: 1/1600)
The value of brightness. The unit is APEX (Additive System of Photographic Exposure)value. (eg: 1)
Distance to the subject ( in meters ) (eg 0.5)
The type of light source used while taking Image/s (eg: Daylight)
Actual Focal length of lens (in mm) (eg: 50mm)
Exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image is captured. (eg 1)
Indicates the Image Source.(eg: Digital Camera)
Indicates the exposure mode when image was shot.(eg: Auto)
Indicates the white balance mode set when image was shot. (for eg Auto or Manual)
Indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by camera when image was shot.
Indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by camera when image was shot.
Angle of camera with which shot was taken (eg: Straight Angle)
The number of columns of image data, equal to number of pixels per row (in pixel) (eg: 3456)
The number of rows of image data, equal to number of pixels per row (in pixel) (eg: 2304)
Pixels per resolution unit in the image width (micrometer/pixel) (eg: 10)
Pixels per resolution unit in the image height. (eg: 10)
Unit of Image Resolution in both height and width direction (eg: milimeter)
Software/firmware of camera or image input device used to generate the image. (eg: Exif Software Version 1.00 )
It refers area/portion in the Image that is of interest
It refers to width of the image after being cropped (in pixels) (eg: 600)
It refers to height of the image after being cropped (in pixels) (eg: 337)
Starting point of crop along x-direction (in pixels) (eg: 400)
Starting point of crop along Y-direction (in pixels) (eg: 400)
Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. Pixel Composition. (eg: RGB)
Additional information regarding the Image Dataset
identifier
